Guide to the Records of the Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission

                    <date></date>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Lara Chmela

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-10-18T12:07-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The Records of the Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission focus on the commission's role in orchestrating the Hudson-Fulton Celebration of 1909. The collection contains correspondence, contracts, vouchers, cancelled checks, financial and legal documents, meeting minutes, clippings, and ephemera.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission Records, The New-York Historical Society.

The celebration was intended to not only commemorate two significant historical achievements, but also encourage "civic pride," start a "historical awakening," "assimilate" the immigrant population, and promote "international friendship" and world peace. Dignitaries from throughout the world were invited to participate, and visitors filled New York hotels beyond capacity. The celebration included banquets and receptions, various parades throughout the city, aquatic competitions, and naval parades among other festivities. Wilbur Wright was hired to perform several aerial demonstrations during the celebration, flying along the Hudson River from Governor's Island to Grant's Tomb. Upon its conclusion, the Hudson-Fulton Celebration was described as a "jubilee of happiness," whereby New York enjoyed two weeks of peace, patriotism, and prosperity.

The bulk of the collection is composed of correspondence and financial documents, particularly payment vouchers. The collection also contains legal documents, organizational materials, clippings, ephemera, and assorted materials unrelated to the Hudson-Fulton Celebration. There is very little visual material, as most of this is housed in the Print Room's collection (see Related Material).

dsc.value:
Series I: Correspondence Subseries I: General Correspondence Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains both the internal and external correspondence of the Commission. While most of the correspondence is arranged alphabetically by sender, letters written by the Commission's secretary, Henry Sackett, and assistant secretary, Edward Hagaman Hall, are filed alphabetically by recipient. This series also contains memoranda sent to members of the Commission.

This subseries consists of replies to the various events sponsored by the Commission, as well as thank you letters commending the Commission on a job well done. Most of the individuals invited to the Celebration and banquets were dignitaries and officials from the United States, as well as countries throughout the world.

This subseries contains all other financial documents related to the operation of the Commission, such as account sheets, ledgers, cashbooks, payroll records, and audit reports.

The vouchers in this subseries document the financial transactions between the Commission and other individuals and companies. The funding source for the various vouchers is noted by the folder title. In addition, this subseries contains schedules for the various vouchers, which act as indexes for the series. The documents are arranged by voucher number.

Series III: Legal Documents Subseries I: Scope and Contents note

The legal documents in this collection consist of materials related to complaints against the Commission, as well as paperwork related to copyrighted materials (i.e. Celebration emblem, etc).

 Certified copies of state laws 30 1 1909 May 3-1909 June 3 Copyright 30 2 1909 Mar. 6-1909 Sept. 11 Erie Railroad Company 30 3 1909-1911 Pain Manufacturing Company 30 4 1909-1910 I.M. Southern & Company 30 5 1909 Sept. 17-1909 Nov. 30 Legal Documents 30 6 1909-1910 Subseries II: Contracts Scope and Contents note

This subseries contains contracts and agreements between the Commission and various other parties, such as bands, architects, and vendors. In some instances, relevant correspondence and documents are filed with the contracts. The contracts are arranged alphabetically by the name of the second party.

This series consists of materials related to the operation of the Commission, such as meeting minutes and stated procedures, as well as logistical materials related to the Celebration.

The ephemera in this collection consists of invitations, programs, tickets, and various other printed materials.

 Invitations 33 1 circa 1909 Printed materials 33 2 circa 1909 Programs 33 3 circa 1909 Tickets 33 4 circa 1909 Series VI: Clippings Scope and Contents note

This series contains magazine and newspaper clippings about the Celebration.

This series contains various drafts for The Fourth Annual Report of the Hudson Fulton Celebration Commission, 1909, many of which contain editing notes.

This series consists of miscellaneous materials related to the collection, such as visiting cards collected at the various events, materials relating to Robert Fulton, obituaries of Commission members, and loose envelopes from the collection.
